result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan James Combs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling per agent to include anger managment and domestic abuse counseling.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan James Combs

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Serve 60 days conditional jail time as an ATR w/ huber

Defendant Jonathan James Combs in court.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 2.  Dismiss/read in Count 1.   State gives recommendation.  Defendant agrees.  Guilty Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 2: 
18 months Probation
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
Anger managment and domestic abuse counseling.  
$243.00 costs, $100.00 domestic abuse surcharge and $200.00 DNA surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.
No violent or abusive contact with anyone and absolute sobreity.

Pre-trial conference at 04-17-2015 08:30 am.
Return date at 04-29-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jonathan James Combs in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $650.00 CASH bond continues.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety and no violent or abusive conduct with anyone.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
